definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Right now you're holding a parachute from a German flare in your hands.
sentences.chinese: 现在你手里拿的是一个德国照明弹上的降落伞。

sentences.english: Road Flare duration increased from 2 minutes to 4 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 道路照明弹的持续时间从2分钟增加到4分钟。

sentences.english: And more importantly , drag it out until flare wears off.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，直到照明弹消失后才离开。

sentences.english: This was in the plane's toolbox. There's only one flare.
sentences.chinese: 这是飞机工具箱里的，只有一个照明弹。

sentences.english: Makes external heat dissipaters and flares.
The flare burst at the moment the japanese started their charge .
sentences.chinese: 照明弹亮起的时候也正是日本人发起冲锋的时候。

sentences.english: Flares fired by Israeli forces light up the sky above the northern Gaza Strip.
sentences.chinese: 以军发射的照明弹照亮了北部加沙地带的夜空。
